name: Carolyn B. Maloney

It is clear gun manufacturers are fueling a public health epidemic and Congress has a responsibility to take bold action to stop them. Their marketing and selling tactics are dangerous and exploitative.
 
We need answers.
https://t.co/8SkHEBrINV

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
We found that Bushmaster, Ruger, Sig Sauer, Daniel Defense, and Smith & Wesson do not track the death and injuries caused by their products. 
 
None of these companies produced any documents requested by the Committee on this matter or about the risks posed by their marketing.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
The gun industry has used white supremacist imagery in its ads. This example from Daniel Defense features shows a shooter with a tattoo of a symbol known as the Valknot. 
 
This symbol is associated w/ white supremacists and is marked a hate symbol by the Anti-Defamation League. https://t.co/wLwncvaC5M

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Video game imagery is also used to sell guns to young people. 
 
The Smith & Wesson ad below the company uses one person shooter camera shots. We also found that gun manufacturers enter into licensing agreements to have their weapons featured in first-person shooter video games. https://t.co/5ORLFTjx45

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Gun manufactures prey on the concept of masculinity to sell their weapons. One commentator found that the intended effect of these ads appeared to be to ‚Äúhumiliate men into arming themselves with combat weapons.‚Äù 
 
This ad üëá is for the bushmaster type rifle used at Sandy Hook. https://t.co/seupgCFGE5

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Gun manufacture Sig Sauer goes further showing military personnel in their ads.
 
Sig proudly sells a ‚Äúpatrol‚Äù version of the MCX Virtus and boasts it was ‚Äúconceived for the demands of the Special Operations community‚Äù & describes it as ‚Äúthe apex predator of the carbine world.‚Äù https://t.co/V1CaSI9jcf

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Another tactic used by the industry is to market their weapons as the gun of choice for the military or law enforcement. https://t.co/mhuOUairnY

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Also disturbing are the selling practices used to push these weapons.

Daniel Defense, the manufacturer of the rifle purchased and used by the Uvalde shooter, offers its firearms for sale through a buy-now, pay-later, financing advertised on the front page of its website. https://t.co/K5Q8k1hb6I

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Our report shows that the gun industry has continued to make massive profits selling weapons of war to our communities. Companies like Daniel Defense and Ruger have amassed huge revenues selling AR-15 Style firearms, the weapon of choice for mass shooters.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚Åì3:30 AM: I take one last look at the Capitol before leaving with my staff. Our democracy, like the building, is deeply damaged but still standing. It is clear that January 6 will not mark the end of the attacks on our democracy. https://t.co/OUlywpVI7B

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 3:24 AM: After all the objections are rejected, Congress completes the counting of the electoral votes, with Biden winning, 306‚Äì232; Vice President Pence affirms the election result, formally declaring Biden the winner.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 3:10 AM: The House rejects, 282‚Äì138, the Republican objection against the counting of Pennsylvania's electoral votes.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 12:55 AM: The Senate rejects, 92‚Äì7, the objection raised by a handful of Republican senators against the counting of Pennsylvania's electoral votes.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 12:15 AM: Republican Rep Scott Perry and Senator Josh Hawley object to the counting of Pennsylvania's electoral votes, triggering a two-hour debate in both chambers.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 11:30 PM: The House votes 303‚Äì121 to reject the objection to Arizona's electoral votes. Whatever hope there was that Rs would let go of the Big Lie in the wake of the mayhem it caused was dashed as a majority of the House GOP gave in to the insurrectionists‚Äô demands.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 11:00 PM: I head down to the House Chamber for the first time that day to vote on the objection to Arizona‚Äôs electoral vote. Dedicated congressional staff are already at work repairing the damage caused that day.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 10:15 PM: The Senate votes 93‚Äì6 against the objection raised by a handful of Republican senators against the counting of Arizona's electoral votes.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 9:00 PM: Speaker Pelosi reopens the House debate. We were determined to finish the job we had come to do and we were not going to leave until it was done.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚Åì 8:15 PM: I leave the office for the first time in 10 hours and head to the Capitol building where there is food waiting for us. There is destruction all around the building. I return back to my office with a pizza for staff. https://t.co/dW8cbhw52T

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 8:00 PM: U.S. Capitol Police declare the Capitol building to be secure.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚Åì 7:00 PM: Facebook and Twitter remove President Trump's posts.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 6:01 PM: President Trump again tweets his Big Lie claims and does not denounce the rioters who came in his name.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 6:00 PM: D.C. curfew comes into effect. It seems that the Capitol has been mostly cleared by this point. I begin taking calls from the press to update my constituents on what is happening. It helps to keep busy as we try to process what just happened. https://t.co/o2EVGN2zFW

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚Åì 5:45 PM: We learn of a staffer next door from my office who has been all alone throughout the insurrection as his boss had been on the floor. We quickly rush him into our office for some added peace of mind.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 5:20 PM: Within 12 minutes of receiving permission, the DC National Guard arrives at the Capitol roughly 4 hours after being requested and more than 3 hours after being prepared to deploy.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 5:08 PM: DC National Guard receives the Secretary of Defense's permission to deploy to the Capitol.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 4:32 PM: Defense Secretary Miller finally authorizes DC National Guard to actually deploy in support of Capitol Police.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 4:17 p.m.: Trump uploads a video to his Twitter repeating his Big Lie claims and telling the rioters, ‚Äúwe love you.‚Äù

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
4:08 PM: Vice President Pence speaks with Acting Secretary of Defense Miller and directs him to ‚Äúclear the Capitol.‚Äù 

Something President Trump should have done from the safety of the White House hours earlier.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
4:05 PM: President-elect Biden holds a press conference calling on President Trump to "demand an end to this siege".
https://t.co/YIS5o4MzGz

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
3:04 PM: Secretary Miller, formally approves "activation" of the DC National Guard. This is not permission to deploy, just to call up National Guard forces to head to the Armory.

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 2:44 PM: Rioter Ashli Babbitt is shot by Capitol Police while attempting to forcibly enter the Speaker's Lobby as members are being evacuated from the House floor.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:30 PM: Secretary Miller, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley, and Army Secretary McCarthy meet to discuss Capitol Police and D.C. government requests.

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
‚Åì2:25 p.m.: Army Secretary McCarthy ordered staff to prepare movement of the emergency reaction force, but to remain at the Armory until he confirmed approval from Acting [Defense Secretary Miller].‚Äù 

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 2:24 PM: Trump tweets an attack against his own Vice President who is being hunted by a mob chanting to hang Mike Pence. It is safe to assume that Trump was looking at the same images as the rest of us and had an idea of the danger the VP was in.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:20 PM: The House is gaveled into recess and begins to evacuate. I will never forget the sight of Speaker Pelosi being whisked away by her security detail.
https://t.co/sjr0ToRqvW

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:19 PM: DC officials advise the DC National Guard that ‚ÄúU.S. Capitol building windows are being broken‚Äù and request that D.C. National Guard members ‚Äúreport to the U.S. Capitol immediately.‚Äù 

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:14 PM: Army Secretary McCarthy instructs DC National Guard to ‚Äústandby.‚Äù

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:14 PM: Officer Eugene Goodman faces the mob by himself. Outnumbered, he uses his wit to keep the mob away from the Senate doors. 

If they had arrived about a minute earlier, they would have been in sight of VP Pence as he was being evacuated. 
https://t.co/Dax6qq8Crd

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:13 PM: Vice President Pence is removed from the Senate chamber and the Senate is gavelled into recess.
https://t.co/UaDBaENDKE

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 2:12 PM: The first rioters enter the Capitol through a window they smashed open. https://t.co/FR4tyAiUtj

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2:10 PM: Chief Sund again contacts the DC National Guard ‚Äúto request immediate assistance and stated 200 Guardsmen were needed and to send more if they are available.‚Äù 

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:59 PM: The rioters reach the Capitol's doors and windows. This was a turning point in the day.

From our vantage point it seemed that Capitol Police was able to fend off the rioters. This was the first clear indication that they were being overrun. https://t.co/xDEKPssO6M

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 1:50 PM: We can hear loud pops from the West Front of the Capitol. Smoke begins to billow the air above the mob. A riot is officially declared. https://t.co/FK9xILo0Fx

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:49 PM: Capitol Police Chief Sund requests immediate assistance from the DC National Guard. Guardsmen are loaded onto buses and are prepared to deploy once permission is granted. 

This would have been a good time to deploy the guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:35 PM: In the Senate, Mitch McConnell warns that refusing to certify the results of the presidential election under false pretenses would push American democracy into a "death spiral". 

It's astounding how easily Rs try to brush off Jan 6 a year later.
https://t.co/LOaNqw5jEC

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:34 PM: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser requests via phone that Army Secretary Ryan D. McCarthy provide additional forces. This is the first of at least 12 such requests from Capitol Police, MPD, and city officials. 

This would have been a good time to deploy the National Guard.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚Åì1:30 PM: We remove the escape hoods, essentially gas masks, and first aid kits from storage and place them on the conference table in my office for easy access if a need arises.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:26 PM: The U.S. Capitol Police order evacuation of the Cannon House Office Building and the Madison Building of the Library of Congress. The mob is now clearly visible from my office.

We lock all of the doors. We begin to receive texts, emails, and calls checking in on us. https://t.co/spZOrXtDJG

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:

https://t.co/GSNw8JPNfc

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 1:10 PM: Trump ends his speech by encouraging the crowd to march to the Capitol: "We‚Äôre going to try and give them [Republicans] the kind of pride and boldness that they need to take back our country.‚Äù

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1:05 PM: Congress meets in a joint session. I remain in my office and watch on tv to avoid any unnecessary exposure or spread of COVID19.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney

name: Carolyn B. Maloney

name: Carolyn B. Maloney

name: Carolyn B. Maloney

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: You can read about all the way the #BuildBackBetter Act will lower drug prices here: 19/ https://t.co/vqXVDwlrzp

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: It would also disincentivize companies from taking price increases by applying an inflation penalty when a manufacturer raises a drug‚Äôs price faster than the rate of inflation. 18/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: The Build Back Better Act would reduce beneficiaries‚Äô share of costs for prescription drugs, set caps on out-of-pocket spending, and realign the cost distribution in the catastrophic coverage phase from the Medicare program to Part D plan sponsors and manufacturers. 17/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ùó£ùóîùó¶ùó¶ ùóßùóõùóò ùóïùó®ùóúùóüùóó ùóïùóîùóñùóû ùóïùóòùóßùóßùóòùó• ùóîùóñùóß: We need the #BuildBackBetter Act, to let Medicare negotiate prices and limit out-of-pocket costs for insulin and other drugs. 16/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
So what can we do about this? 

4 VERY BIG THINGS: 
 
1) Pass the #BuildBackBetter Act
 
2) Address Anticompetitive Practices
 
3) Prohibit Anticompetitive Pay-for-Delay Agreements
 
4) Ensure Transparency of R&D Costs 

15/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
What's more, companies‚Äô investments in R&D are far outpaced by revenue gains, and the companies spend more on stock buybacks and dividends than on R&D. 
 
I have an entire thread about this üëá 14/
https://t.co/tW70aZJ6x8 https://t.co/CLg5pz0awI

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
So how does Big Pharma respond to this criticism?

They point to the generosity of their patient assistance programs.

BUT, new evidence shows that companies emphasized the significant ROI from these programs in the form of increased sales.

Big Pharma, "help you, help me." 13/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
We also uncovered new evidence of ‚Äúshadow pricing,‚Äù where would-be competitors follow each other‚Äôs price increases.  Internal docs show that the 3 largest insulin makers raised prices in lockstep to maintain ‚Äúpricing parity.‚Äù 12/
 
Again, just look at the charts üëá https://t.co/1PYCNBkDex

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: What does this look like? Contracting and marketing strategies like:  11/ https://t.co/LkXd25rIKW

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Every company engaged in 1 or more strategies to suppress competition from generics or biosimilars.  10/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Evidence shows that companies use patent protections and market exclusivities granted by FDA to suppress generic competition and keep prices high. 
 
Just look at this chart üëá 
 
A shameful abuse of the system. 9/ https://t.co/3s1tuZV8Bw

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Docs show several companies targeted Medicare to boost revenues. An internal Novo Nordisk slide deck emphasized, ‚ÄúPart D is the most profitable market for the Novo Nordisk insulin portfolio.‚Äù 8/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: We also obtained non-public pricing data revealing that taxpayers could have saved more than $25B over 5 years for just 7 drugs-if private Medicare Part D plans received the same discounts as other federal health programs that can negotiate, according to our analysis.7/ https://t.co/wBY05UqU5t

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Price increases = $$$ for Big Pharma. 
 
The 10 companies generated  $38.5B in U.S. net revenues from the sales of just 12 drugs in 2019 alone.

We found evidence that execs made pricing decisions to meet revenue targets and earnings goals, not for research and development. 4/ https://t.co/c9JmBjItAh

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Net prices‚Äîprices after accounting for rebates and other discounts‚Äîof nearly all of the drugs ‚¨ÜÔ∏è year over year.    
 
This data, which hasn't been public before, undermines Big Pharma's claims that price increases are primarily due to, and offset by, rebates and discounts.  3/

My Federal Advisory Committee Transparency Act would make these sorts of committees more transparent and accountable.  We must pass this bill to prevent future abuses. 20/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Documents obtained by the Committees show that the Trio also sought to use their roles to promote their personal agendas. 19/20 https://t.co/Gn4RJPdArE

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Documents also show the Trio sought to exert dominance over White House staff charged with implementing policies for veterans. 18/20 https://t.co/wiuviajTrK

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: In March 2017, Perlmutter sent Kushner an agenda for a meeting with President Trump that included the ‚ÄúTechnology Transfer and Economic Benefits of Licensing‚Äù ‚Äî the proposal to monetize veterans‚Äô data.  Kushner responded, ‚ÄúGreat ‚Äî he is excited for your dinner together!‚Äù 17/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: According to a presentation prepared by J & J, a next step was to ‚ÄúWork through legal barriers on getting access to VHA EMR [Veterans Health Administration Electronic Medical Records] databases.‚Äù  It is unclear what steps, if any, the VA took to implement this initiative. 16/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Dr. Moskowitz stated that ‚ÄúJ&J, CVS, and Apple all wanted the database‚Äù and that J & J ‚Äúwant[s] the VA databank and biobank which will be hugely profitable to them.‚Äù  15/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: The Trio worked with Sec Shulkin to award a consulting contract to Terry Fadem, the fmr president of Moskowitz‚Äôs nonprofit foundation, to explore monetizing VA patient data. Fadem proposed that patient data ‚Äúbe leveraged into hundreds of millions in revenue.‚Äù  14/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: The Trio held discussions on behalf of the federal government with Johnson & Johnson, Apple, and CVS Health after being introduced by Ivanka Trump (utilizing her personal email account) and Jared Kushner to the CEOs of each company‚ÄîAlex Gorsky, Tim Cook, and Larry Merlo.  13/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Documents show that the Trio developed and implemented a range of plans to overhaul the VA and sought to outsource VA functions, including by monetizing VA patient data through the development of a commercial platform for veterans‚Äô medical records.  12/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Documents reveal the Trio also actively sought to conceal their activities. 11/20 https://t.co/n5EdgUPG12

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Kushner wrote that Mr. Perlmutter ‚Äúis going to help us fox [sic] the VA.  He is someone we trust 100%.‚Äù 10/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Documents show that President Trump and senior WH officials empowered this group of secret advisors.
 
Kushner introduced Mr. Perlmutter to the Deputy Administrator for the U.S. Digital Service the day before Trump‚Äôs inauguration. 9/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Mr. Perlmutter asserted in response, ‚ÄúThe good news is that we have been advised that FACA does not apply because we are not a formal group in any way.‚Äù 8/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Assistant to the President Reed Cordish wrote in an email to Mr. Perlmutter in April 2017, ‚Äúto do what you outlined below you will need to form a FACA group‚Äù and to ‚Äúhave your attorney reach out to WH Counsel Stefan Passantino (copied) to start that process.‚Äù 7/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: On January 25, 2017, the VA Office of General Counsel attorney assigned to work on FACA matters wrote to then-VA Secretary nominee David Shulkin that ‚Äúit appears FACA may be implicated‚Äù by the Trio‚Äôs formation.  Mr. Shulkin forwarded the email to Dr. Moskowitz the same day. 6/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: The Trio was informed by multiple federal officials that their work constituted an advisory committee, which is subject to FACA. 5/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: President Trump formed an advisory committee made up of Ike Perlmutter, Marc Sherman, and Dr. Bruce Moskowitz to ‚Äútransform the VA‚Äù in early 2017.  4/20

name: Carolyn B. Maloney

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2. Crackdown on abuses of our patent system that discourage competition and keep prices high. 

I have already taken actions like requesting the @FTC   investigate @abbvie to determine whether their egregious anticompetitive behaviors violated the law.
https://t.co/WPzU3RslfQ

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
So what can we do about this? 

1. Pass H.R. 3, the Elijah E. Cummings Lower Drug Prices Now Act. Right now drug companies set prices and Medicare has no ability to negotiate them down. Other fed health programs, like the VA, that are able to negotiate, pay significantly less.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
3. Between 2016 and 2020 the top 14 Big Pharma execs made $3.2B. That's more than a quarter-billion on average per company. And it grew by 14% over that time. 

Could price increases be avoided if they weren't so greedy? 

Could any of that money be used on real R&D? https://t.co/velj0BdCGc

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
By abusing patents, by slightly tweaking how a drug is made or administered, they are able to keep prices high while providing minimal to no added benefit to patients.

They spend billions on this and claim it's a necessary part of their life-saving research.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
2. When you and I think "research & development," we think about innovation to produce new drugs or improve existing ones.

But, many of these companies spent significant portions of their "R&D" budgets on suppressing generic or biosimilar versions of their drugs from coming out.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
1. From 2016-2020, the 14 biggest drug makers spent $56 BILLION more on stock buybacks and dividends than R&D.

$56B more to enrich execs & investors instead of developing & improving medications.

They're projected to spend $1.15 trillion on buybacks & dividends from 2020-2029. https://t.co/OWXGhUdEs5

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
Big Pharma's favorite talking point is that without the high prices they charge, they would not be able to produce life-saving drugs. 

This is a lie.

Our 2-year @OversightDems investigation, started by the late Chairman Cummings, now has the internal docs showing why üßµüëá

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: RT @SophiaBush: Get vaccinated.

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text:
üì¢ Drug companies spent a significant portion of their R&D budget on finding ways to suppress generic and biosimilar competition while continuing to raise prices.
 
American consumers deserve better‚Äîthey need H.R.3 https://t.co/E6Qho6hple

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: At 6:56 p.m., Mr. Meadows forwarded Mr. Rosen a document alleging voting irregularities and problems with Dominion machines in New Mexico and asking Mr. Rosen for his ‚Äúteam to review the allegations contained herein.‚Äù   fin

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Mr. Rosen forwarded this email to Mr. Donoghue with the comment:  ‚ÄúCan you believe this?  I am not going to respond to the message below.‚Äù  36/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: At 4:13 p.m., Mr. Meadows sent another email to Mr. Rosen, writing:  ‚ÄúThere have been allegations of signature match anomalies in Fulton county, Ga.  Can you get Jeff Clark to engage on this issue immediately to determine if there is any truth to this allegation.‚Äù  35/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Mr. Rosen explained to Mr. Donoghue that after receiving the message, he was asked to have the FBI meet with Brad Johnson, who Mr. Rosen learned ‚Äúis working with Rudy Giuliani.‚Äù  Mr. Rosen said he refused the request.  34/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: At 3:08 p.m., Mr. Meadows sent Mr. Rosen a YouTube link referencing the Italy conspiracy, labeled ‚ÄúBrad Johnson:  Rome, Satellites, Servers:  an Update.‚Äù  Mr. Rosen forwarded the email to Mr. Donoghue, who responded:  ‚ÄúPure insanity.‚Äù  33/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: On January 1, 2021, Mr. Meadows emailed Mr. Rosen on three separate occasions to provide unsubstantiated claims about election fraud or ask him to take direct action to change the results:  32/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ...and loaded onto ‚Äúmilitary satellites.‚Äù  This individual claimed that the true data, as well as sources within the conservative wing of the Italian secret service, confirmed that Donald Trump was ‚Äúclearly the winner‚Äù of the 2020 election.  31/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Later on Dec 30, Mr. Meadows emailed Mr. Rosen a translation of a document from an individual in Italy claiming to have ‚Äúdirect knowledge‚Äù of a plot by which American electoral data was changed in Italian facilities ‚Äúin coordination with senior US intelligence officials (CIA)‚Äù30/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Mr. Meadows wrote to Mr. Rosen:  ‚ÄúCan you have your team look into these allegations of wrongdoing.  Only the alleged fraudulent activity.‚Äù   29/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: During that call,  President Trump reportedly asked Georgia election officials to ‚Äúfind‚Äù enough votes to declare him the winner of the state.  The December 30 email contained allegations of ‚Äúvideo issues in Fulton County.‚Äù  28/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: On December 30, 2020, Mr. Meadows forwarded Mr. Rosen an email from Cleta Mitchell, a Trump advisor who later participated in a January phone call with Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.  27/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Newly released documents substantiate recent reports that former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows pressured DOJ officials‚Äîon at least five occasions‚Äîto investigate baseless claims of election fraud or put pressure on other officials to pursue these claims.  26/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 25/ https://t.co/rwoyfN22rd

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Later that evening, Mr. Donoghue emailed Mr. Pak with the subject line ‚ÄúPlease call ASAP.‚Äù  Mr. Pak resigned less than 10 hours later, reportedly under pressure from the Trump White House.  24/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: After the meeting, Associate Deputy Attorney General Patrick Hovakimian reported to his colleagues:  ‚Äúit sounds like Rosen and the cause of justice won.‚Äù  23/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: The January 3 meeting was described in press reports as an ‚ÄúApprentice‚Äù-like battle during which President Trump considered ‚Äúwhether to fire Mr. Rosen and replace him with Mr. Clark‚Äù who was sympathetic to the President‚Äôs election fraud claims.  22/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Later that day, President Trump referred to Mr. Pak as a ‚Äúnever-Trumper U.S. Attorney‚Äù while discussing two videos purporting to show fraudulent votes in Fulton County with Georgia Secretary of Secretary Brad Raffensberger.  21/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: On January 2, 2021, Mr. Rosen followed up with Mr. Clark regarding his call with Mr. Pak.  Mr. Clark replied, ‚ÄúI spoke to the source and am on with the guy who took the video right now.  Working on it.  More due diligence to do.‚Äù  20/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Later that day, Mr. Rosen sent Mr. Clark the cell phone number of then-U.S. Attorney for the Northern District of Georgia Byung J. Pak with the subject line ‚Äúatlanta.‚Äù   That day, Mr. Clark also emailed Dustin Carmack, Chief of Staff to the DNI, to request a call.  19/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: On January 1, 2021, White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows directed Mr. Rosen to have Mr. Clark look into ‚Äúsignature match anomalies in Fulton county, GA.‚Äù  18/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Emails confirm that on Dec 31, 2020, and Jan 3, 2021, President Trump met with Mr. Rosen, then-Assistant Attorney General Jeffrey Clark, and other DOJ officials.  During these meetings, President Trump reportedly pressured them to challenge the results of the 2020 election.  17/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: 16/ https://t.co/vy8nrqwJLC

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Mr. Olsen previously represented Texas in its failed lawsuit to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election.  15/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: Emails indicate Mr. Rosen discussed the filing with Mr. Olsen on or around December 29, 2020, and asked Mr. Olsen to send him SCOTUS precedent supporting the arguments in the complaint.  14/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: I have been instructed to report back to the President this afternoon after this meeting.‚Äù  In a separate email to the Acting Solicitor General, Mr. Olsen added, ‚ÄúThis is an urgent matter.‚Äù  13/

name: Carolyn B. Maloney
tweet_text: ‚ÄúAs I said on our call, the President of the United States has seen this complaint, and he directed me last night to brief AG Rosen in person today and discuss bringing this action...  12/
